item.title: Use Cisco AnyConnect to Connect to a VPN from the Command Line on Mac OS
item.description: After moving to a new office location, a lot changed – including the network setup. Different than before, we have to use Cisco AnyConnect now to connect to the VPN. Still, there are different VPNs depending on what I’m working on but everything else is quite different. First of all, this means I can neither use networksetup nor scutil which I have used in my previous script to manage my VPN any longer.

item.title: Connect to a VPN from the Command Line on Mac OS
item.description: During Corona time, I have to connect to a VPN most of the time in order to work. I use two different VPNs depending on what I’m working on. I can select the network to connect to from the status bar at the top of the screen but there seems to be a bug: Sometimes there isn’t anything to select, so I have to go to the network preferences and connect from there.
